TITLE: Putin's Orthodox Christmas cease-fire begins, but is rejected as a cynical ploy by Ukraine and its allies
SUMMARY: The 36-hour truce declared by Russia came into effect at midday Moscow time (4 a.m. ET), but Kyiv dismissed the suggestion of a pause in the hostilities for the holiday

TITLE: House speaker vote highlights: McCarthy elected speaker on 15th ballot after making concessions to far-right rebels
SUMMARY: McCarthy prevailed early Saturday after he was able to whittle away hard-liners who opposed him over 14 rounds of voting

TITLE: South Carolina Supreme Court strikes down state abortion ban
SUMMARY: The decision marked a significant victory for abortion rights’ advocates suddenly forced to find safeguards at the state level after the U.S. Supreme Court overturned Roe v. Wade in June

TITLE: The House speaker election, in three charts
SUMMARY: It’s been more than 200 years since a speaker election went this many rounds

TITLE: Conservative leader Matt Schlapp is accused of fondling a male campaign staffer
SUMMARY: The Herschel Walker campaign aide said the conservative leader groped him without his consent in October

TITLE: Canada and the U.S. both face labor shortages. One country is increasing immigration.
SUMMARY: Canada’s government plans to accept 1.45 million immigrants by 2025, many with badly needed job skills. In the U.S., immigration legislation is stalled

TITLE: Congress has failed for over two decades to reform immigration — here's a timeline
SUMMARY: The outlook for any meaningful immigration reform in the new Congress is bleak

TITLE: Video shows border agents, police arresting migrants sleeping outside church shelter in El Paso ahead of Biden's visit
SUMMARY: Immigration advocates say the proximity of the arrests to a church shelter may violate the Biden administration's own policies

TITLE: Indiana Rep. Jim Banks announces bid for Braun's Senate seat
SUMMARY: The staunch Trump ally announced his bid for the seat that fellow Republican Mike Braun is vacating to run for governor

TITLE: Reps. Marjorie Taylor Greene and Paul Gosar get committee assignments after Democrats kicked them off
SUMMARY: While holding the majority in 2021, House Democrats removed Greene and Gosar from their assigned committees because of controversial posts they made on social media

TITLE: Losing GOP candidate arrested in string of shootings at New Mexico Democrats' homes
SUMMARY: Albuquerque police announced the arrest of Solomon Peña and said that he had expressed anger over his loss in November and alleged that election fraud had played a role

TITLE: Embattled Rep. Santos awarded seats on Science and Small Business committees
SUMMARY: Some Republicans had called for the New York Republican to be barred from all committees after he lied about major parts of his personal biography

TITLE: Matt Schlapp slapped with a lawsuit after an allegation of fondling a GOP operative
SUMMARY: The male GOP staffer, who remains unnamed in the lawsuit, said the conservative movement leader groped him in a car without his consent

TITLE: Puerto Rico on its way to privatizing power generation despite widespread skepticism
SUMMARY: Critics worry the process could further delay Puerto Rico’s transition to renewable energy and still not bring access to reliable electricity to an island riddled with power outages

TITLE: West must ramp up aid to Ukraine to keep war with Russia from becoming a stalemate, U.K. foreign secretary says
SUMMARY: “We can’t allow this to drag on and become a kind of First World War attritional-type stalemate,” said James Cleverly

TITLE: Capitol Police investigated more than 7,500 threats against lawmakers last year
SUMMARY: The number of threat investigations in 2022 dipped for the first time in years, but it was still elevated and almost double the amount from 2017

TITLE: Solomon Pena was belligerent to neighbors who opposed his political views, condo official says
SUMMARY: The failed GOP candidate for local office is accused of hiring four people to shoot at the homes of Democratic leaders in Albuquerque, New Mexico

TITLE: What the 21 McCarthy holdouts got in committee assignments
SUMMARY: Nearly two dozen House Republicans prevented Kevin McCarthy from quickly securing the speaker’s gavel. Some made out better than others in committee seats

TITLE: Fireworks in House after Democrat says 'insurrectionists' should be banned from leading Pledge of Allegiance
SUMMARY: A routine House Judiciary Committee meeting erupted into a nearly hourlong heated debate Wednesday over the Pledge of Allegiance

TITLE: AP African American studies course is watered down after pressure from Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis
SUMMARY: In the revised syllabus for the course, the College Board made substantial revisions to sections criticized by the Florida Republican's administration

TITLE: Michigan Republicans are in turmoil as their leaders navigate tricky Trump terrain
SUMMARY: Republicans are now completely out of power in the Midwest battleground state and struggling to settle on a path forward

TITLE: GOP Rep. Andy Biggs announces articles of impeachment against DHS Secretary Mayorkas
SUMMARY: The Arizonan unsuccessfully introduced articles of impeachment against Alejandro Mayorkas in 2021, when Democrats controlled the House

TITLE: No classified documents found in FBI search of Biden's beach house, lawyer says
SUMMARY: The FBI searched the house after documents with classified markings from the Obama administration were found in Biden’s Wilmington residence and a Washington think tank office

TITLE: Republicans quash Democratic ban on carrying guns in a congressional committee room
SUMMARY: A Democratic amendment to ban firearms from the hearing room for the GOP-led House Natural Resources Committee sparked a contentious debate Wednesday

TITLE: Connecticut Latino lawmakers propose banning 'Latinx,' calling it 'offensive'
SUMMARY: The bill's sponsor, state Rep. Geraldo Reyes Jr., says Spanish language "defaults to 'Latino'" for everybody, while supporters of Latinx say the gendered term 'Latino' is exclusionary

TITLE: Congress presses Secret Service for more details about state-sponsored foreign hackers stealing Covid relief funds
SUMMARY: At a House Oversight Committee hearing Wednesday, members from both parties cited an NBC News report about a group linked to China's government stealing millions

TITLE: Gas stove debate reignites as Energy Department proposes new standards
SUMMARY: In a move that's likely to inflame critics, the proposal seeks certain efficiency thresholds for both gas and electric stoves

TITLE: Pence’s home searched by FBI, one classified document found
SUMMARY: FBI agents searched former Vice President Mike Pence’s Indiana home, removing “one document with classified markings and six additional pages,” according to Pence’s spokesman. NBC News’ Garrett Haake has more details on the investigation.&nbsp

TITLE: In Texas lawsuit seeking to reverse FDA approval of abortion pills, state attorneys general weigh in
SUMMARY: A decision from a Trump-appointed judge could come later this month in a lawsuit alleging that the FDA’s approval of two abortion medications was unlawful

TITLE: Sex, drugs and deleted ballots? New Mexico elections official hit with ethics charge
SUMMARY: A state agency filed an ethics lawsuit against a Republican county clerk, who allegedly mishandled ballots and a Taser

TITLE: White House and Fox struggle to agree on terms of Biden Super Bowl interview
SUMMARY: A White House official indicated no interview was in the works after a Fox Corp. spokesperson said FOX Soul would interview the president for Super Bowl Sunday

TITLE: U.S. blacklists 6 Chinese entities over spy balloon program
SUMMARY: The move is likely to further escalate the diplomatic row between the U.S. and China sparked by the balloon, which was shot down last weekend off the Carolina coast

TITLE: Trump's legal team turned over folder with classified markings to Justice Department
SUMMARY: Trump’s lawyers provided the folder voluntarily and told the DOJ it came from Mar-a-Lago, a senior law enforcement official told NBC News

TITLE: 'A serious committee': Lawmakers have high bipartisan hopes for China panel as tensions rise
SUMMARY: The spy balloon isn't the focus of the new House committee on China, but it underscores the military, economic and technological threat from Beijing, Republicans and Democrats say

TITLE: Utah's GOP governor defends new ban on gender-affirming care
SUMMARY: Gov. Spencer Cox said that the state Legislature does not have enough information and evidence to allow the treatment in an interview on NBC News' "Meet the Press

TITLE: What you need to know about the four high-altitude objects shot down over North America
SUMMARY: The unidentified object the U.S. shot down Sunday over Lake Huron was the fourth taken down over North America in less than two weeks
